update.description:
* This substitutes the interface based on `jQuery-UI` with one based on `jQuery Mobile` (they're incompatible)
* Desktop only (touch not there yet)
* Deleted `jQuery-UI` files
* Added `jQuery Mobile` files
* Mode icons (view|translate|rotate) back to lighter shade
* Shape icons not used yet (sphere|cylinder|box)
* Play/Pause icons adapted from Gazebo
* index.html and gzgui.js reflect the new interface
* window.innerWidth and innerHeight substituted with window.containerWidth and containerHeight to take header and footer into account
* Spawned shapes show transparent before being placed to differentiate from existing ones
* JSDoc documentation (inline comments)
update.title: jQueryMobile interface for desktop version

content.raw: That was overriding textures for complex meshes. Commit dcb9c23 solves that.
content.html: That was overriding textures for complex meshes. Commit dcb9c23 solves that.

content.raw:
* Oh and I went ahead and added texts to the buttons when they're hovered like on Gazebo (i.e. "Translation Mode (T)").

* Also made it possible to go to view mode with the `Esc` key.

Here is a [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/wtks3mc8w6ixhok/gzwebDesktop.png) showing most of the new stuff.
content.html:
• Oh and I went ahead and added texts to the buttons when they're hovered like on Gazebo (i.e. "Translation Mode (T)").

  • Also made it possible to go to view mode with the Esc key.

Here is a screenshot showing most of the new stuff.

content.raw:
I've added a few commits responding to your requests:

* For wide screens, the menu starts open and can only be closed by clicking the `X` button.
* The use of RT hotkeys is consistent now
* Menu icons changed: `+` -> `>` , `-` -> `V`
* Menu font sizes changed: contents have font 13px and menu items font 15px. Let me know if these sizes are nice.
* Multiple menu items can be expanded at the same time.
* Footer contents grouped to the right. Let me know if you'd like some more space between them.
content.html:
I've added a few commits responding to your requests:

  • For wide screens, the menu starts open and can only be closed by clicking the X button.
  • The use of RT hotkeys is consistent now
  • Menu icons changed: + -> > , - -> V
  • Menu font sizes changed: contents have font 13px and menu items font 15px. Let me know if these sizes are nice.
  • Multiple menu items can be expanded at the same time.
  • Footer contents grouped to the right. Let me know if you'd like some more space between them.

content.raw: By the way, after some discussion today we decided to re-target this to a new branch. The new branch will focus on integration issues between gzweb-mobile and gzweb-desktop. I'll create that branch now
content.html: By the way, after some discussion today we decided to re-target this to a new branch. The new branch will focus on integration issues between gzweb-mobile and gzweb-desktop. I'll create that branch now

content.raw:
Thank you for your comments.

1. Do you still want to give the user the chance to collapse the menu or should it be always open? And when you say desktop, do you mean large screens or non-touch devices? I can set it to either one or both.

2. I'll start working on this.

3. I'll start working on this.

4. Just to make sure, you mean the + becomes > and the - becomes v ?

5. They are the same for me...

6. I'm not sure I understand the trackpad question. If 1 finger pans, how do you control the mouse tip?
content.html:
Thank you for your comments.

  1. Do you still want to give the user the chance to collapse the menu or should it be always open? And when you say desktop, do you mean large screens or non-touch devices? I can set it to either one or both.

  2. I'll start working on this.

  3. I'll start working on this.

  4. Just to make sure, you mean the + becomes > and the - becomes v ?

  5. They are the same for me...

  6. I'm not sure I understand the trackpad question. If 1 finger pans, how do you control the mouse tip?

content.raw:
Ok, here are some suggestions/comments:

* If we detect that the desktop version is being used, the left column menu should be auto-expanded to save the user from having to open the menu. This means that once a shape is selected (to be added to the scene), the menu should not auto-collapse. 
* The RT hotkeys don't work on the desktop. Pressing R on the keyboard should switch to rotate mode, and T to translate mode. When already in R or T mode, pressing the hotkey for the other mode switches the markers as expected, but the indicator in the top right corner does not change to reflect the current mode. 
* I did this, which is buggy: Went to Translate mode, then pressed R and the markers changed to Rotate, then I clicked a different shape and the markers were Translate although they should have been Rotate (because I had pressed R to switch to Rotate)
* In the menu, I would change the +/- symbols to be > and the same one but facing downward. This is the more standard symbol for expanding and collapsing in this type of accordion menu.
* Are the font sizes the same on Reset World and Reset Model Poses? They should be.
* This may be out of scope (if it is, Ian, where should we add it so we don't forget about it?): For users with no mouse (who are on a laptop), we need trackpad controls. For now, we can have 1 finger pan, 2 fingers orbit. The panning works now, but the orbiting does not. Pinching zooms the entire page, not the scene itself. Is there a way around that, or is it a Mac/browser setting that can't be changed?
content.html:
Ok, here are some suggestions/comments:

  • If we detect that the desktop version is being used, the left column menu should be auto-expanded to save the user from having to open the menu. This means that once a shape is selected (to be added to the scene), the menu should not auto-collapse.
  • The RT hotkeys don't work on the desktop. Pressing R on the keyboard should switch to rotate mode, and T to translate mode. When already in R or T mode, pressing the hotkey for the other mode switches the markers as expected, but the indicator in the top right corner does not change to reflect the current mode.
  • I did this, which is buggy: Went to Translate mode, then pressed R and the markers changed to Rotate, then I clicked a different shape and the markers were Translate although they should have been Rotate (because I had pressed R to switch to Rotate)
  • In the menu, I would change the +/- symbols to be > and the same one but facing downward. This is the more standard symbol for expanding and collapsing in this type of accordion menu.
  • Are the font sizes the same on Reset World and Reset Model Poses? They should be.
  • This may be out of scope (if it is, Ian, where should we add it so we don't forget about it?): For users with no mouse (who are on a laptop), we need trackpad controls. For now, we can have 1 finger pan, 2 fingers orbit. The panning works now, but the orbiting does not. Pinching zooms the entire page, not the scene itself. Is there a way around that, or is it a Mac/browser setting that can't be changed?

content.raw: Yes. Cool, so the icons are there :)
content.html: Yes. Cool, so the icons are there :)

content.raw: [This](https://www.dropbox.com/s/rdl2sqb1qjj3iki/gzweb_new_interface.png) is what I have. Is that the same as yours?
content.html: This is what I have. Is that the same as yours?

content.raw: Added commit cc75b4d because models with unspecified materials were ending up the color of the temp spawned models, which now includes a transparency.
content.html: Added commit cc75b4d because models with unspecified materials were ending up the color of the temp spawned models, which now includes a transparency.

content.raw: to resolve the conflicts, pull from the gzweb `default` branch and merge this branch with it. It should let you know that there are conflicts and you can use Meld or kdiff3 to resolve these conflicts, or just manually edit the files and do `hg resolve`
content.html: to resolve the conflicts, pull from the gzweb default branch and merge this branch with it. It should let you know that there are conflicts and you can use Meld or kdiff3 to resolve these conflicts, or just manually edit the files and do hg resolve
